verses.verse: He entered a ship, crossed over, and came into his own city.
And look, they brought a paralyzed man, lying on a bed. Jesus seeing their faith said to the paralyzed: "Son, take courage; your sins are forgiven."
And behold some of the Pharisees, said in themselves, "This man blasphemes."
And Jesus knowing thoughts said, "Why do you think this evil in your hearts?
"Which is easier to say your sins are forgiven or to say: «get up and walk?»
"So that you will know that the Son of Man has authority on the earth to forgive sin" --he then says to the paralyzed-- "get up, pick up your bed, and go to your house."
So he got up and left for his house.
When the crowd saw this, they were amazed and gave glory to God who gave this kind of authority to men.
Leaving there Jesus saw a man sitting in the tax collector's office named Matthew, and he said to him, "Follow me", and he got up and followed him.
And it so happened that Jesus sat for a meal in the house, and behold, many tax collectors and sinners came to sit for a meal with Jesus and his disciples.
When the Pharisees saw this they said to his disciples, "Why is your teacher eating with tax collectors and sinners?
But when Jesus heard this he said to them, "Those who are well don't need a physician only those who are sick.
"Go and learn what this means, «I want mercy not sacrifice», for I did not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance."
Then the disciples of John came to him saying, "Why do we and the Pharisees often fast, but your disciples do not fast?
Jesus answered them, "Can the friends of the bridegroom grieve while the bridegroom is with them? The time will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they will fast.
"No one puts a piece of new cloth on an old garment, for what fills shrinks [pulls away?] and the tear becomes worse.

"Nor do they put new wine into old skin bottles, otherwise the skin bottles will break, the wine pours out, and the skin bottles destroyed. Instead put new wine into new skin bottles and both are preserved".
While he was speaking these things to them, look, one came, knelt before him, saying, "My daughter has just died, but come, lay your hand on her, and she will live."
Jesus got up and followed him along with his disciples.
And behold, a woman losing blood for twelve years, came behind him and touched the hem of his garment.
She said to herself: «If I only touch the hem of his garment, I will be healed.»
But Jesus turned around and saw her and said, "Daughter, take courage; your faith has made you well." The woman became well at that very moment.

When Jesus came into the ruler's house and saw the flute players and the people loudly wailing, [24] he said to them, "Move aside, for the girl is not dead but is sleeping." And they scornfully laughed at him.
But when the people were driven out, he went in and took her by the hand and the girl got up.
The news of this spread all over that region.
After Jesus left there, two blind men followed him, shouting, and saying, "Son of David, have mercy on us."
When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him, and Jesus said, "Do you believe, that I am able to do this"? They said to him, "Yes, Lord."
Then he touched their eyes, saying, "As is your faith, so may it be."
Their eyes were opened, and Jesus strictly ordered them, saying, "See, that no one knows it."
But they, after they had left, spread the news about him, in that entire region.
As they left, see, they brought a demon-possessed man [who was] unable to speak.
When the devil was thrown out the man [who was] unable to speak, spoke, and the throng was amazed saying, "This has never been seen in Israel!
But the Pharisees said, "He throws out devils by the chief of the devils".
Jesus went around to all the cities and villages, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the gospel of the kingdom, and healing every sickness and every disease among the people.
As he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them, because they grew weak and were scattered like sheep having no shepherd.
Then he said to his disciples, "The harvest is truly great, but the laborers are few,
"Pray therefore to the Lord of the harvest, so that he will send laborers into his harvest."
